channel.title: Rate this template
channel.description:
Hello fellow moparscape web developers, I've been working on FroyoScape's website template and here is the outcome. I know it's basic but it's something most of you can't do :P
Ok here they, tell me which is better
1.top: http://prntscr.com/j3hud 1.bottom: http://prntscr.com/j3hvo
Or
2.top: http://prntscr.com/j3hxu 2.bottom: http://prntscr.com/j3hzs
Thanks, Sibor :)

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t see to much of a difference from the two. What are we rating here? Whether we like burger king over McDonald’s or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:466219”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=578502.msg4156380#msg4156380 date=1352725648]

I know it’s basic but it’s something most of you can’t do

You shouldn’t get cocky with something that looks like shit. The banner isn’t too bad, but the rest of the site isn’t the best, someone could easily learn how to do this in about a week. It’s just simple html and simple simple css.
[/quote]
The banner would be better if it had a transparent background.[/quote]

Agreed.

Read full topic

You shouldn’t get cocky with something that looks like shit. The banner isn’t too bad, but the rest of the site isn’t the best, someone could easily learn how to do this in about a week. It’s just simple html and simple simple css.[/quote]

item.title: Rate this template

item.description:
@error.login wrote:

The second I prefer, I think you should add some color, remove the indentation of the header and maybe update the navigation a bit with images and such

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @Sibor Sibor
item.description:
@Sibor wrote:

Ok and that’s a great idea, have a side bar for news/updates thanks man.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

You need to work more on the design aspects of both templates. The first one is my personal favourite but it doesn’t seem to have a unique feel to it where it should, in my opinion. Don’t get me wrong I’m all for simple templates but I believe this is just a bit too simple.

Maybe in the columns to the left and right you could incorporate some form of latest news and latest posts kind of thing? If you’re using SMF you could just make use of the SSI.

Read full topic
